vulns.details: The Requests package through 2.19.1 before 2018-09-14 for Python sends an HTTP Authorization header to an http URI upon receiving a same-hostname https-to-http redirect, which makes it easier for remote attackers to discover credentials by sniffing the network.

The Requests package before 2.20.0 for Python sends an HTTP Authorization header to an http URI upon receiving a same-hostname https-to-http redirect, which makes it easier for remote attackers to discover credentials by sniffing the network.
OctoPrint prior to 1.8.3 allows a user with read access only to access a privileged user's account and functionality. Version 1.8.3 contains a patch for this issue.

Versions of OctoPrint prior to 1.8.3 did not require the current user password in order to change that users password. As a result users could be locked out of their accounts or have their accounts stolen under certain circumstances.

vulns.summary: OctoPrint vulnerable to Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type
vulns.details: OctoPrint prior to version 1.8.3 is vulnerable to Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type. Due to misconfiguration in move file functionality, an attacker could easily change the file extension of an uploaded malicious file disguised as a `.gcode` file. Version 1.8.3 contains a patch.

vulns.summary: OctoPrint vulnerable to Insufficient Session Expiration.
vulns.details: If an attacker comes into the possession of a victim's OctoPrint session cookie through whatever means, the attacker can use this cookie to authenticate as long as the victim's account exists. This issue is fixed in version 1.8.3.

vulns.summary: OctoPrint vulnerable to Special Element Injection
vulns.details: OctoPrint prior to 1.8.3 is vulnerable to Special Element Injection.
If an attacker comes into the possession of a victim's OctoPrint session cookie through whatever means, the attacker can use this cookie to authenticate as long as the victim's account exists.
Improper Privilege Management in GitHub repository octoprint/octoprint prior to 1.8.3.
Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type in GitHub repository octoprint/octoprint prior to 1.8.3.
